data.title: Who is Chelsea Clinton? 6 things to know about Hillary Clinton's daughter, Day 4 speaker on DNC schedule
authors: Susan K. Livio | NJ Advance Media for NJ.com
data.meta_description: Chelsea Clinton, the only child of Hillary and Bill Clinton, will introduce her mother at the Democratic National Convention. Prior to her DNC speech tonight (Thursday, 7/28/2016) Chelsea Clinton has been sitting in the gallery next to her husband, Marc Mezvinsky.
data.text:
She was born when her father, Bill Clinton, was governor of Arkansas and grew up inside the White House.

But tonight Chelsea Clinton, 36, makes her most high-profile appearance on the political stage when she introduces her mother, Hillary Clinton, the first woman to win a major party's nomination and Donald Trump's opponent in the general election this November.

For years, Chelsea Clinton's parents protected her from the spotlight - a practice she continued as an adult until she started doing select magazine interviews several years ago. She also served a stint as a correspondent for NBC News.

Here's a quick rundown of the person she has become.

Family life: She married hedge-fund manager Marc Mezvinsky, whose mother, Marjorie Margolies-Mezvinsky, was a member of Congress. They have a daughter, Charlotte, who turns two in September, and a son, Aidan, who was born in June. They live in Manhattan.

Scholarly pursuits: She graduated from Stanford University with a history degree and holds a master's degree in international relations from Oxford University. After a stint on Wall Street, she earned a master's degree in public health from Columbia University and a PhD from Oxford University.

So many professional hats: She is vice president of the Clinton Foundation, which funds and launches projects on global health, climate change and female empowerment.

She spent six years in the private sector, worked for the Wall Street consulting firm McKinsey & Company and a hedge fund.

She was a special correspondent for NBC News, earning $600,000, according to Politico. Media critics sharply questioned the hire.

Trivia: Her Secret Service codename was "Energy." Her speeches have fetched $65,000 a pop, which is donated to the foundation. She skipped the third grade and studied ballet.
